body: I just ran the js tests on Ubuntu 14.10 with [this Dockerfile](https://gist.github.com/minrk/542a739c56178e8d8f6d), so it doesn't seem to be generic to all Ubuntu systems. I'm not sure what could be causing the hang on your machines.

I'm not sure. I tried to follow the installation as in your dockerfile, but I'm still unable to complete the tests. The only differences I noticed were:
1. apt-get install -y npm nodejs-legacy
2. pip install -e git+https://github.com/ipython/ipython#egg=ipython[notebook]

In the first one, you're using npm from the Ubuntu repository. right? I'm using the npm preinstalled from the PPA `ppa:chris-lea/node.js`. I also didn't install nodejs-legacy. Is that needed? I installed it a moment ago but didn't help. 

In the second point, that pip install didn't work in my case, it says: `no matches found: git+https://github.com/ipython/ipython#egg=ipython[notebook]`. If I remove, the "[notebook]" part, then it works.

**UPDATE**

Now I see why you need `nodejs-legacy`. There was a name collision in the repositories that required a change of name from `node` to `nodejs`. A symlink is offered in that "legacy" package. I installed that version but it doesn't help the issue.

**UPDATE 2**:

When I try the same test after installing Ipython 2.4.1, it works:
    (test5)➜  ~  iptest js/tree

```
Test group: js/tree
Running tests with notebook directory '/tmp/tmp_9x_x8'

Platform       : Linux-3.16.0-30-generic-x86_64-with-debian-jessie-sid

Tools and libraries available at test time:
   casperjs curses jinja2 pexpect pygments sqlite3 tornado zmq

Tools and libraries NOT available at test time:
   cython matplotlib numpy oct2py pymongo qt requests rpy2 sphinx

Status: OK (1 test groups). Took 3.933s.
```

Maybe it is something about `pip install -e git+https://github.com/ipython/ipython#egg=ipython[notebook]`. Since I can't run that, the notebook doesn't appear in `conda list` even though the notebook works correctly.

The error after running `pip install -e git+https://github.com/ipython/ipython#egg=ipython[notebook]` is actually an error from the shell. However, I tried to do this in an ec2 instance running  Ubuntu 14.04 and the tests finish, but there is a page error in the test that is giving me issues:

This is what I did from the bash history:

```
(ipython-master)ubuntu@ip-10-150-45-247:~$ history 
    1  sudo apt-get update
    2  sudo apt-get install -y npm nodejs-legacy git libfreetype6 libfontconfig
    3  npm -v
    4  npm install -g phantomjs casperjs
    5  sudo npm install -g phantomjs casperjs
    6  curl http://09c8d0b2229f813c1b93-c95ac804525aac4b6dba79b00b39d1d3.r79.cf1.rackcdn.com/Anaconda-2.1.0-Linux-x86_64.sh -o anaconda.sh
    7  bash anaconda.sh
    8  conda
    9  conda create -n ipython-master python
   10  source activate ipython-master
   11  conda install pip pyzmq tornado jinja2 nose mock
   12  which pip
   13  pip install -e git+https://github.com/ipython/ipython#egg=ipython[notebook]
   14  conda list
   15  which iptest
   16  iptest js/tree
   17  conda install requests
   18  iptest js/tree
   19  iptest js
```
Closing for inactivity and as notebook is now it's own package.
